alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 26 at 8:06PM CDT until April 29 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Sand Hill River at Climax affecting Polk County. Red Lake River at Highlanding near Goodridge affecting Pennington County. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. Roseau River at Roseau affecting Roseau County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. .Runoff from recent heavy rain and snowmelt continues to affect area rivers. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River below Warren. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 71.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 69.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Tuesday was 69.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning and continue falling to 63.7 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 67.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
